data.title: Breaking Bad (2008–2013)
data.summary: A high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer turns to manufacturing and selling methamphetamine in order to secure his family's future.

data.title: The Wire (2002–2008)
data.summary: Baltimore drug scene, seen through the eyes of drug dealers and law enforcement.

data.title: Sherlock (2010– )
data.summary: A modern update finds the famous sleuth and his doctor partner solving crime in 21st century London.

data.title: The Sopranos (1999–2007)
data.summary: New Jersey mob boss Tony Soprano deals with personal and professional issues in his home and business life that affect his mental state, leading him to seek professional psychiatric counseling.

data.title: Sacred Games (2018– )
data.summary: A link in their pasts leads an honest cop to a fugitive gang boss, whose cryptic warning spurs the officer on a quest to save Mumbai from cataclysm.

data.title: True Detective (2014– )
data.summary: Seasonal anthology series in which police investigations unearth the personal and professional secrets of those involved, both within and outside the law.

data.title: Fargo (2014– )
data.summary: Various chronicles of deception, intrigue and murder in and around frozen Minnesota. Yet all of these tales mysteriously lead back one way or another to Fargo, North Dakota.

data.title: Narcos (2015–2017)
data.summary: A chronicled look at the criminal exploits of Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar, as well as the many other drug kingpins who plagued the country through the years.

data.title: Peaky Blinders (2013– )
data.summary: A gangster family epic set in 1919 Birmingham, England; centered on a gang who sew razor blades in the peaks of their caps, and their fierce boss Tommy Shelby.

data.title: Twin Peaks (1990–1991)
data.summary: An idiosyncratic FBI agent investigates the murder of a young woman in the even more idiosyncratic town of Twin Peaks.

data.title: Better Call Saul (2015– )
data.summary: The trials and tribulations of criminal lawyer, Jimmy McGill, in the time leading up to establishing his strip-mall law office in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

data.title: La casa de papel (2017– )
data.summary: Eight thieves take hostages and lock themselves in the Royal Mint of Spain as a criminal mastermind manipulates the police to carry out his plan.

data.title: Dexter (2006–2013)
data.summary: By day, mild-mannered Dexter is a blood-spatter analyst for the Miami police. But at night, he is a serial killer who only targets other murderers.

data.title: Daredevil (2015– )
data.summary: Matt Murdock, with his other senses superhumanly enhanced, fights crime as a blind lawyer by day, and vigilante by night.

data.title: The Punisher (2017– )
data.summary: After the murder of his family, Marine veteran Frank Castle became a vigilante known as "The Punisher" with only one goal in mind, to avenge them.

data.title: Wentworth (2013– )
data.summary: Bea Smith is locked up while awaiting trial for the attempted murder of her husband and must learn how life works in prison.

data.title: Deadwood (2004–2006)
data.summary: A show set in the late 1800s, revolving around the characters of Deadwood, South Dakota; a town of deep corruption and crime.

data.title: Bodyguard (2018– )
data.summary: A contemporary thriller featuring the Royalty and Specialist Protection Branch of London's Metropolitan Police Service.

data.title: Sons of Anarchy (2008–2014)
data.summary: A man in his early 30s struggles to find a balance in his life between being a new dad and his involvement in a motorcycle club.

data.title: Mr. Robot (2015– )
data.summary: Elliot, a brilliant but highly unstable young cyber-security engineer and vigilante hacker, becomes a key figure in a complex game of global dominance when he and his shadowy allies try to take down the corrupt corporation he works for.

data.title: Mindhunter (2017– )
data.summary: In the late 1970s, two FBI agents expand criminal science by delving into the psychology of murder and getting uneasily close to all-too-real monsters.

data.title: Big Little Lies (2017– )
data.summary: The apparently perfect lives of three mothers of first graders unravel to the point of murder.

data.title: Dark (2017– )
data.summary: A family saga with a supernatural twist, set in a German town, where the disappearance of two young children exposes the relationships among four families.

data.title: Justified (2010–2015)
data.summary: Old-school U.S. Marshal Raylan Givens is reassigned from Miami to his childhood home in the poor, rural coal mining towns in eastern Kentucky.

data.title: Boardwalk Empire (2010–2014)
data.summary: An Atlantic City, New Jersey politician plays both sides of the law, conspiring with gangsters during the Prohibition era.

data.title: Hannibal (2013–2015)
data.summary: Explores the early relationship between the renowned psychiatrist and his patient, a young FBI criminal profiler, who is haunted by his ability to empathize with serial killers.

data.title: Poirot (1989–2013)
data.summary: From England to Egypt, accompanied by his elegant and trustworthy sidekicks, the intelligent yet eccentrically-refined Belgian detective Hercule Poirot pits his wits against a collection of first class deceptions.

data.title: Luther (2010–2018)
data.summary: DCI John Luther is a near-genius murder detective whose brilliant mind can't always save him from the dangerous violence of his passions.

data.title: American Crime Story (2016– )
data.summary: An anthology series centered around America's most notorious crimes and criminals.

data.title: Line of Duty (2012– )
data.summary: DS Steve Arnott is transferred to the police anti-corruption unit after the death of a man in a mistaken shooting during a counter-terrorist operation.

data.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine (2013– )
data.summary: Jake Peralta, an immature, but talented N.Y.P.D. detective in Brooklyn's 99th Precinct, comes into immediate conflict with his new commanding officer, the serious and stern Captain Ray Holt.

data.title: Homeland (2011– )
data.summary: A bipolar CIA operative becomes convinced a prisoner of war has been turned by al-Qaeda and is planning to carry out a terrorist attack on American soil.

data.title: The Americans (2013–2018)
data.summary: At the height of the Cold War two Russian agents pose as your average American couple, complete with family.

data.title: Psych (2006–2014)
data.summary: A novice sleuth is hired by the police after he cons them into thinking he has psychic powers which help solve crimes. With the assistance of his reluctant best friend, the duo take on a series of complicated cases.

data.title: Person of Interest (2011–2016)
data.summary: An ex-assassin and a wealthy programmer save lives via a surveillance AI that sends them the identities of civilians involved in impending crimes. However, the details of the crimes--including the civilians' roles--are left a mystery.

data.title: Prison Break (2005–2017)
data.summary: Due to a political conspiracy, an innocent man is sent to death row and his only hope is his brother, who makes it his mission to deliberately get himself sent to the same prison in order to break the both of them out, from the inside.

data.title: Bosch (2014– )
data.summary: An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer.

data.title: 24 (2001–2010)
data.summary: Jack Bauer, Director of Field Ops for the Counter-Terrorist Unit of Los Angeles, races against the clock to subvert terrorist plots and save his nation from ultimate disaster.

data.title: Broadchurch (2013–2017)
data.summary: The murder of a young boy in a small coastal town brings a media frenzy, which threatens to tear the community apart.

data.title: Banshee (2013–2016)
data.summary: An ex-con assumes the identity of a murdered sheriff in the small town of Banshee, Pennsylvania, where he has some unfinished business.

data.title: Ozark (2017– )
data.summary: A Chicago-based financial advisor relocates his family to the Missouri Ozarks when his dealings with a drug cartel go awry.

data.title: Sharp Objects (2018– )
data.summary: A reporter confronts the psychological demons from her past when she returns to her hometown to cover a violent murder.

data.title: Ray Donovan (2013– )
data.summary: Ray Donovan, a professional "fixer" for the rich and famous in Los Angeles, can make anyone's problems disappear except those created by his own family.

data.title: The Good Wife (2009–2016)
data.summary: Alicia has been a good wife to her husband, a former state's attorney. After a very humiliating sex and corruption scandal, he is behind bars. She must now provide for her family and returns to work as a litigator in a law firm.

data.title: Longmire (2012–2017)
data.summary: Walt Longmire is the dedicated and unflappable sheriff of Absaroka County, Wyoming. Widowed only a year, he is a man in psychic repair but buries his pain behind his brave face, unassuming grin and dry wit.

data.title: White Collar (2009–2014)
data.summary: A white collar criminal agrees to help the FBI catch other white collar criminals using his expertise as an art and securities thief, counterfeiter, and conman.

data.title: Sneaky Pete (2015– )
data.summary: A con man on the run from a vicious gangster takes cover by assuming the identity of his prison cellmate, Pete, reuniting with his estranged family, that threatens to drag him into a world ...                See full summary »

data.title: Orange Is the New Black (2013– )
data.summary: Convicted of a decade old crime of transporting drug money to an ex-girlfriend, normally law-abiding Piper Chapman is sentenced to a year and a half behind bars to face the reality of how life-changing prison can really be.

data.title: Power (I) (2014– )
data.summary: James "Ghost" St. Patrick, a wealthy New York night club owner who has it all, catering to the city's elite and dreaming big, lives a double life as a drug kingpin.

data.title: Lucifer (2015– )
data.summary: Lucifer Morningstar has decided he's had enough of being the dutiful servant in Hell and decides to spend some time on Earth to better understand humanity. He settles in Los Angeles - the City of Angels.

data.title: How to Get Away with Murder (2014– )
data.summary: A group of ambitious law students and their brilliant criminal defense professor become involved in a twisted murder plot that promises to change the course of their lives.

data.title: Castle (2009–2016)
data.summary: After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes.

data.title: Columbo (1971–2003)
data.summary: Los Angeles homicide detective Lieutenant Columbo uses his humble ways and ingenuous demeanor to winkle out even the most well-concealed of crimes.

data.title: The Fall (I) (2013– )
data.summary: A seemingly cold but very passionate policewoman goes head to head with a seemingly passionate father who is in fact a cold serialist in this procedural out of Belfast. The only thing they share is their common complexity.

data.title: Mayans M.C. (2018– )
data.summary: Set in a post-Jax Teller world, "Mayans MC" sees EZ Reyes, a former golden boy now fresh out of prison, as a prospect in the Mayan MC charter on the California-Mexico border who must carve out his new outlaw identity.

data.title: Criminal Minds (2005– )
data.summary: The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again.

data.title: The Blacklist (2013– )
data.summary: A new FBI profiler, Elizabeth Keen, has her entire life uprooted when a mysterious criminal, Raymond Reddington, who has eluded capture for decades, turns himself in and insists on speaking only to her.

data.title: Lethal Weapon (2016– )
data.summary: A slightly unhinged cop is partnered with a veteran detective trying to maintain a low stress level in his life.

data.title: Animal Kingdom (2016– )
data.summary: Centers on a Southern California family, whose excessive lifestyle is fueled by their criminal activities.

data.title: Jessica Jones (2015– )
data.summary: Following the tragic end of her brief superhero career, Jessica Jones tries to rebuild her life as a private investigator, dealing with cases involving people with remarkable abilities in New York City.

data.title: Unforgotten (2015– )
data.summary: London detectives investigate crimes from the past; unraveling secrets left buried for years.

data.title: Chicago P.D. (2014– )
data.summary: Follows District 21 of the Chicago Police Department, which is made up of two distinctly different groups: the uniformed cops and the Intelligence Unit.

data.title: The Mentalist (2008–2015)
data.summary: A famous "psychic" outs himself as a fake, and starts working as a consultant for the California Bureau of Investigation so he can find "Red John", the madman who killed his wife and daughter.

data.title: Murdoch Mysteries (2008– )
data.summary: In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.

data.title: The Sinner (2017– )
data.summary: Anthology series that examines how and why ordinary people commit brutal crimes.

data.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (1999– )
data.summary: The Special Victims Unit, a specially trained squad of detectives in the NYPD, investigate sexually related crimes.

data.title: Monk (2002–2009)
data.summary: Adrian Monk is a brilliant San Francisco detective, whose obsessive compulsive disorder just happens to get in the way.

data.title: Gotham (2014– )
data.summary: The story behind Detective James Gordon's rise to prominence in Gotham City in the years before Batman's arrival.

data.title: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service (2003– )
data.summary: The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington DC Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.

data.title: Elementary (2012– )
data.summary: A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.

data.title: Bones (2005–2017)
data.summary: Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.

data.title: Death in Paradise (2011– )
data.summary: A British inspector is transferred to Saint-Marie's police department, but he hates the sun, sea, and sand. The series follow his investigations into murders on the island. Later series see another British DI head the investigative team.

data.title: iZombie (2015– )
data.summary: A medical resident finds that being a zombie has its perks, which she uses to assist the police.

data.title: El Chapo (2017– )
data.summary: A look at the life of notorious drug kingpin, El Chapo, from his early days in the 1980s working for the Guadalajara Cartel, to his rise to power of during the '90s and his ultimate downfall in 2016.

data.title: Get Shorty (2017– )
data.summary: The adventures of mobster-turned-movie producer Hollywood. TV show based on Elmore Leonard's novel and subsequent film.

data.title: Good Girls (2018– )
data.summary: Three suburban mothers suddenly find themselves in desperate circumstances and decide to stop playing it safe and risk everything to take their power back.

data.title: Midsomer Murders (1997– )
data.summary: A veteran DCI and his young sergeant investigate murders around the regional community of Midsomer County.

data.title: Queen of the South (2016– )
data.summary: Teresa flees Mexico after her drug-runner boyfriend is murdered. Settling in Dallas she looks to become the country's reigning drug smuggler and to avenge her lover's murder.

data.title: Arrow (2012– )
data.summary: Spoiled billionaire playboy Oliver Queen is missing and presumed dead when his yacht is lost at sea. He returns five years later a changed man, determined to clean up the city as a hooded vigilante armed with a bow.

data.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation (2000–2015)
data.summary: An elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts work their cases in Las Vegas.

data.title: Law & Order (1990–2010)
data.summary: Follows a crime, usually adapted from current headlines, from two separate vantage points, the police investigation and the prosecution in court.

data.title: Snowfall (2017– )
data.summary: A look at the early days of the crack cocaine epidemic in Los Angeles during the beginning of the 1980s.

data.title: Riverdale (2016– )
data.summary: A subversive take on Archie and his friends, exploring small town life, the darkness and weirdness bubbling beneath Riverdale's wholesome facade.

data.title: The Closer (2005–2012)
data.summary: Deputy Police Chief Brenda Johnson runs the Priority Homicide Division of the LAPD with an unorthodox style. Her innate ability to read people and obtain confessions helps her and her team solve the city's toughest, most sensitive cases.

data.title: Blue Bloods (2010– )
data.summary: Revolves around a family of New York cops.

data.title: Luke Cage (2016– )
data.summary: When a sabotaged experiment gives him super strength and unbreakable skin, Luke Cage becomes a fugitive attempting to rebuild his life in Harlem and must soon confront his past and fight a battle for the heart of his city.

data.title: Blindspot (2015– )
data.summary: Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body.

data.title: Hawaii Five-0 (2010– )
data.summary: Steve McGarrett returns home to Oahu, in order to find his father's killer. The Governor offers him the chance to run his own task force (Five-0).

data.title: Take Two (II) (2018– )
data.summary: A private investigator in Los Angeles reluctantly teams up with a former star of a hit cop show.

data.title: Karppi (2018–2019)
data.summary: When Sofia Karppi, a detective in her 30's who is trying to get over her husband's death, discovers the body of a young woman on a construction site, she triggers a chain of events that ...                See full summary »

data.title: Bull (2016– )
data.summary: BULL stars Michael Weatherly as Dr. Jason Bull in a drama inspired by the early career of Dr. Phil McGraw, the founder of one of the most prolific trial consulting firms of all time. ...                See full summary »

data.title: Murder, She Wrote (1984–1996)
data.summary: Professional writer and amateur sleuth Jessica Fletcher uses her intellect, charm, and persistence to get to the bottom of every crime she encounters.

data.title: NCIS: New Orleans (2014– )
data.summary: A spin-off of NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service (2003) about the local field office of NCIS that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment and decadence. This colorful city that harbors a dark side is a magnet for service personnel on leave, and when overindulgence is followed by trouble, Special Agent Dwayne ...                See full summary »

data.title: Iron Fist (2017– )
data.summary: A young man is bestowed with incredible martial arts skills and a mystical force known as the Iron Fist.

data.title: Quantico (2015–2018)
data.summary: A look at the lives of young FBI recruits training at the Quantico base in Virginia when one of them is suspected of being a sleeper terrorist.

data.title: NCIS: Los Angeles (2009– )
data.summary: The Naval Criminal Investigation Service's Office of Special Projects takes on the undercover work and the hard to crack cases in LA. Key agents are G. Callen and Sam Hanna, streets kids risen through the ranks.

data.title: S.W.A.T. (2017– )
data.summary: Follows a locally born and bred S.W.A.T. lieutenant who is torn between loyalty to the streets and duty to his fellow officers when he's tasked to run a highly-trained unit that's the last stop for solving crimes in Los Angeles.

data.title: Instinct (2018– )
data.summary: A former CIA operative (Cumming), who has since built a "normal" life as a gifted professor and writer, is pulled back into his old life when the NYPD needs his help to stop a serial killer on the loose.

data.title: Magnum P.I. (2018– )
data.summary: An ex-Navy SEAL returns home from Afghanistan and uses his military skills to become a private investigator in Hawaii.
